ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: a recompense from your Lord, a commensurate gift.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: A recompense from your Lord, a sufficient gift,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: a recompense from your Lord and an ample reward
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This will be their reward from your Lord, a favor from Him and a recompense for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: A reward from your Lord – a grossly sufficient bestowal.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Rewarded from your Lord with a sufficient gift.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A reward from your Lord, a gift according to a reckoning:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: for a recompense from thy Lord, a gift, a reckoning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Requital from thy Lord - a gift in payment -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: all this will be a recompense, a gift, that will suffice them, from your Lord,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: A recompense from thy Lord-a gift sufficient -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —a reward and a sufficing bounty from your Lord,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Recompense from thy Lord, a gift, (amply) sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: A reward from your Lord, an ample calculated gift (according to the best of their good deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: a recompense from your Lord, a gift, a reckoning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A reward from your Lord, a fitting gift.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [78:36] [this will be] a reward from your Lord, in other words, God has rewarded them with this reward as, a gift (‘atā’an substitutes for jazā’an, ‘reward’) that is sufficing, [that is] abundant (hisāban, [as meaning ‘abundant’] derives from their saying a‘tānī fa-ahsabanī, ‘he gave me so abundantly that I said, “that is enough for me”’ [hasbī]),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Requital) a reward (from thy Lord a gift) that He bestows upon them in the Garden (in payment) ten rewards for each good deed; and it is also said this means: reward in proportion to their good deeds
